li.a: I will be sending a learning packet home each Monday with work to be completed and returned to school. There will also be completed work that you need to keep at home. If you have any questions, please contact me by email or school phone.
Learning packets will be picked up every Monday at the cafeteria in a drive through manner.

div.p: Ector Independent School District is dedicated to providing the highest quality learning experience in a safe, caring, and nurturing environment to all students. Our students will develop positive moral values, achieve full academic potential, and acquire skills necessary for continuous learning.

img.alt: Second picture relating to Mission Statement

visible-xs hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg hidden-xl text-center
section.style: background-color:#000;color:#fff; padding:20px; background:url(https://s3.amazonaws.com/scschoolfiles/446/design_img__jizqos.png);background-size:cover;background-position: center center; background-repeat: no-repeat;

div.h4: NO IN SCHOOL INSTRUCTION FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR
div.p: The Ector ISD Board of Trustees voted to cancel all in school instruction for the rest of the school year due to the COVID-19 outbreak. We will educate the students at home for the rest of the year. Our teachers have been calling parents to let them know about picking up packets of work for each student. Pick up times are every Monday from 8:00 am - 3:30 pm in a drive thru so you do not have to get out of your vehicle. This is how your student will get the grades they need to finish up their school year.

strong.span: Ector ISD has 100% Highly Qualified Teachers and Teacher's Aides for the 2019-2020Â School year

strong.br: We would like to welcome you to Ector Independent School District's Web Page. Our school consists of approximately 266Â students on a K-12 campus.

span.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 255); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 20px; font-weight: bold; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

br.span: Ector Independent School District is dedicated to providing the highest quality learning experience in a safe, caring, and nurturing environment to all students. Our students will develop positive moral values, achieve full academic potential, and acquire skills necessary for continuous learning. These traits will provide the tools necessary for graduates of Ector to become contributing members of society, be life-long learners, and be successful in future endeavors.

div.class: custom_15215 img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated wow animated zoomIn

span.span: Board of Trustee Election in May has been Delayed

Our Board of Trustees voted to delay the May 2, 2020 election to November after the Governor did a Proclamation that the May election could be delayed due to the Covid-19 pandemic. The new election day is going to be on November 3, 2020. The ballot that has already been done will be the same, the date has just been moved.

a.span: Click here to see the Proclamation.

span.span: We are in need of substitute teachers. If you or you know anyone that might be interested please pass it along. There is a application on our Job Listings link.Â Choose the Substitute application to print it out and bring it to the school. You may also pick one up at the school.

span.b: Ector ISD is participating in the Cash for my Class at Brookshires. Be looking for a letter coming home with your student(s). We have the cards available at the school for you to pick up if you are interested.Â

span.strong: School Messenger is aÂ notification system we use to notify parents of early school closure or bad weather, etc. Notifications can be sent via phone(recorded voice message), cell (recorded voice message or SMS text) or Email. In order to be notified you need to make sure the school has your up to date home phone number, cell phone number and/or email address. Contact Marcia Bush in the Superintendentâ€™s office 903-961-5405. To receive SMS(text) you must make sure we have your current cell phone number in our system, and

a.span: click here to follow these directions to set it up.

span.strong: Please save and send your Box Tops to our school. We are going to continue utilizing this program for our school. Please continue to save throughout the school year and send them with your child at anytime. We really appreciate any and all Box Tops we get.Â

span.style: text-align: center; color: rgb(0, 0, 255); line-height: 20.79px; font-family: sans-serif, Arial, Verdana,

span.br: Â Contact Marcia Bush if you want the information to sign up for Parent Portal. We do not send it home with every student, only by request.

div.strong: New Lunch Prices for the 2019 -2020 School Year

strong.span: Due to circumstances beyond our control we have had to raise the price for lunches. It will be $2.00 per student and $3.00 per adult. Breakfast will still be $1.25 per student.
